intro: Ruehssia altissima subsp. altissima, commonly known as the tall ruehssia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
